channel.title: New town release
channel.description:
Ok i worked bit on my first little Town it was just to get grips. I thought i would release just because i think it is kind of cool and i want to show off my first try at it. [URL=http://img514.imageshack.us/i/screenshot2f.png/][IMG]http://img514.imageshack.us/img514/8803/screenshot2f.png[/img][/URL] [URL=http://img19.imageshack.us/i/screenshot3uo.png/][IMG]http://img19.imageshack.us/img19/2338/screenshot3uo.png[/img][/URL] [URL=http://img99.imageshack.us/i/screenshot6i.png/][IMG]http://img99.imageshack.us/img99/9674/screenshot6i.png[/img][/URL] [URL=http://img299.imageshack.us/i/screenshot4j.png/][IMG]http://img299.imageshack.us/img299/8763/screenshot4j.png[/img][/URL]
Landscape.rscd download: http://www.mediafire.com/?mkuowwmw0cy go to coords 71 21 and it will take u there
[code]<NPCLoc> <id>95</id> <startX>84</startX> <startY>9</startY> <minX>81</minX> <maxX>87</maxX> <minY>7</minY> <maxY>12</maxY> </NPCLoc> <NPCLoc> <id>208</id> <startX>72</startX> <startY>20</startY> <minX>68</minX> <maxX>76</maxX> <minY>19</minY> <maxY>26</maxY> </NPCLoc>[/code]

commandhandler.class [code] if(cmd.equals("pkcity")) { if(player.getLocation().inModRoom() && !player.isMod()) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot use ::pkbox here"); } else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - player.getLastMoved() < 10000 || System.currentTimeMillis() - player.getCastTimer() < 10000) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("There is a 10 second delay on using ::pkcity, please stand still for 10 secs"); } else if(!player.inCombat() && System.currentTimeMillis() - player.getCombatTimer() > 10000) { player.setCastTimer(); player.teleport(73, 19, true); } else { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot use ::pkcity for 10 seconds after combat"); } return; }[/code]

item.title: New town release
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Next you should experiment with the second story and see how placing ladders works out. Maybe then create an underground tunnel with a lower elevation than the area around it.

Read full topic

item.title: New town release
item.dc:creator: @pompio pompio
item.description:
@pompio wrote:

[quote=“darscape, post:6, topic:340102”]Looks like you have the streets curving and the correct width which is pretty good. I like the different textures used for the fenced in dirt area.

Were you using the slider for an overlay color with the landscape editor to color the tiles?[/quote]

Yes i was just took my time and worked everything out on landscape editter. I will work on another one tommorow and try better my self. If anyone has requests on what they would like to see i will do it. All this is done for my own intrest not even wanting to make a server lol… So yeah add pompio@live.ca if you wanna speak or suggest stuff or even give me tips

Read full topic

item.title: New town release
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Looks like you have the streets curving and the correct width which is pretty good. I like the different textures used for the fenced in dirt area.

Were you using the slider for an overlay color with the landscape editor to color the tiles?

Read full topic

item.title: New town release
item.dc:creator: @ghostfire ghostfire
item.description:
@ghostfire wrote:

heh sorry, im just observant but it does look cool tho

Read full topic

item.title: New town release
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

ghostfire:

yeah looks kinda cool. noticed a bench facing the wrong way. (sorry u need a LITTLE criticism :P) but yeah looks gr8

I never even noticed that -_-;

Read full topic

item.title: New town release
item.dc:creator: @ghostfire ghostfire
item.description:
@ghostfire wrote:

yeah looks kinda cool. noticed a bench facing the wrong way. (sorry u need a LITTLE criticism :P) but yeah looks gr8

item.title: New town release
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Doesn’t look too bad for your ‘first’ time using the Landscape editor. I’ve seen and done a lot worse.

Good job…

Read full topic
